question.body: During development, what cells fuse to form muscle fibers?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Osteocytes are mature bone cells.
Correct. Myoblasts do migrate and fuse to form fibers.
Incorrect. Myocytes are mature muscle cells.
Incorrect. Satellite cells fuse to the muscle cell.

question.body: Which of the following is not true about satellite cells?

multiple_choice.choice: They are not able to divide.
They can fuse with muscle cells.
They can limitedly regenerate muscle fibers.
They can repair damage in living cells.

response.feedback: Correct. Satellite cells are able to divide.
Incorrect. Satellite cells can fuse with muscle cells.
Incorrect. They can induce limited regeneration in muscle fibers.
Incorrect. Satellite cells repair damage in living cells.
